key_title: Key to the species of Utricularia

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Lentibulariacerae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Lentibulariacerae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Corolla mainly yellow; leaves divided into capillary segments; bracteoles absent; plant a suspended or rooted aquatic herb
Corolla mainly pink or violet, sometimes white; leaves undivided or apparently absent; bracteoles present; plant a terrestrial herb of moist places
Ultimate segments of each leaf numerous, usually 20–80; upper corolla lip smaller than lower
Ultimate segments of each leaf few, usually 2–8; upper corolla lip larger than lower
Calyx 2-lobed
Calyx 4-lobed
Sterile bracts absent from peduncle
Sterile bracts present on peduncle below lowest flower
Stolons present with leaves and traps at their nodes; inflorescence 1-many-flowered
Stolons absent, all leaves and traps arising from a short stem at base of peduncle; inflorescence 1-flowered; rare, in far south-west
Bracts and bracteoles attached to stems at base; upper lobe of perianth uniformly coloured
Bracts and bracteoles attached to stems distiinctly above base; upper lobe of perianth usually with darker flecks
Central 2 yellow ridges on lower corolla lip not projecting apically beyond those on either side
Central 2 yellow ridges on lower corolla lip projecting apically beyond those on either side
Lower corolla lip with 4–11 radiating yellow ridges; spur shorter than lower lip; corolla mostly dark violet
Lower corolla lip with central pair of ridges yellow, lateral ridges white; spur c. as long as lower lip; corolla mostly mauve or lilac
Inflorescence 10–50 cm high, usually 2-many-flowered; corolla 12–22 mm long
Inflorescence 1–4 cm high, usually 1-flowered; corolla 6–10 mm long; rare plant from the Bogong High Plains
Bracts and bracteoles attached to stems near midpoint (lower lobe up to 1.5 time length of upper lobe); central 2 yellow ridges of lower perianth lobe not exceeding the adjacent ridges

Bracts and bracteoles attached to stems distinctly below midpoint (upper lobe up to twice the length of lower lobe); central 2 yellow ridges of lower perianth lobe more prominently raised and exceeding the adjacent ridges
